title: Proposals Mentors Marketplace
description: 提案者は、Catalystのプロセスを円滑に進め、質の高い提案を提出することが難しいと感じています。

f6_assessments.q0: As matching new proposers with mentors may result in an increase of ideas submitted from new members of the community, the proposal effectively addresses the challenge. An influx of new members and ideas has a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have outlined a plan with various options to implement their idea and showcased that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully with an understandable and reasonable budget breakdown.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics make sense and are easily auditable. The assessor confirmed with the proposing team that this solution will be open-sourced, increasing the auditability score even further.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the problem at hand referring to proposals that could not be funded during the fund 5 process due to lack of proper presentation
f6_assessments.q1: The team has adequate experience to execute the proposal and have given detailed outline of plan of execution which makes it quite visible.
f6_assessments.q2: There is detail budget attached here which makes the proposal auditable

f6_assessments.q0:
YES! A big YES! This goes beyond submitting proposals and drives submitting QUALITY PROPOSALS. As I started reading the proposal, I was immediately inspired and started getting ideas...

"Hey, this could go hand-in-hand with projectcatalyst.org"... oh, it's there.

"Hey, you could do this on-chain"... oh, they've thought about it. Should this be successful in incentivizing mentor-proposer relationships, the smart contracts can then be extended to automate most of Project Catalyst incentives - taking a load off of IOG's shoulders and enabling further decentralization.

I initially thought this would be a great way to match experienced CAs with the proposers whose proposals they fall in love with during the assessment period. But, coming to think of it, this should allow any Project Catalyst member (lurker, proposer, team member, voter, CA, VCA) to contribute to a project at any point of the project's lifecycle.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan is really well thought-out and the proposers are definite pros. The partnerships seem to be well-chosen and there's willing to do this together with the rest of the community.

Should the funding be granted, this will be done. No doubt about that.

I have been both a Proposer and a CA and I know the frustrations on both sides. This could help alleviate the frustrations, help Project Catalyst scale and increase the quality of proposals.
f6_assessments.q2:
All success metrics are in place and it is easy to track the progress of this proposal. It's good that the financial sustainability of the proposal is considered already at this point. The free version is the way to go in the beginning.

My only concern is, who will get to decide a) if and when a fee is levied and b) who decides where that money goes?

Development idea:
This could be the first step towards a Catalyst DAO where the entire community gets to have a say in such governance decisions and where a native governance token drives decentralized democracy and allows people to participate on an even keel, regardless of their ADA holdings.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is really great and certainly could help people to build their proposals and enrich their ideas. However, if the fee based model is fully implemented, it would limit the reach to those who already can afford. A way to overcome this would be a hybrid model where those who can pay for this service do so, but those who cant are able to apply for some financial aid from Cardano community. It would extend the reach of the second fund model (let's say, for instace, to low income country as the ones in Africa) without fully overloadind the Cardano community (as in the first model). Another way to extend even more the reach of it is looking for extra mentors from different countries or who speak different languaged other than english (when the platform grows).
A main concern here regarding the campaign as a whole (proposer outreach) is that this solution alone maybe  wouldnt bring much new proposers, at least at firts (thats why I'm not giving a 5), but it will certainly increase the quality of the new proposals. A proper communication plan and marketing strategy could help overcoming this.
Other thing that could be added here is how the platform will ensure mentors are qualified and how they will be ranked. Will there be a selection process? A Curriculum analysis? Mentors with not enough qualification could lead to a bad experience here.
f6_assessments.q1:
Two qualified  mentors seems enough for a MVP. Developers will be hired and thats definitely essential. Just not giving 5  because its still needed to hire 3 developers (they are not part of the team yet).

Project plan is satisfactory and budget breakdown seems sensible.
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics are sensible but it could have some target spread out in months or funds.
some extra metrics could be: # of people after a mentor, success rate comparison from people who applied before and after platform usage,
rate of conversion (# of proposal approved submited by people who used the platform/# of total proposals applied from people who used the platform).

some risks could have been considered in the proposal related to the quality of mentors and how to address that.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal supports the challenge objectives by providing a building block to help facilitate  production of better quality proposals. It will also act to simplify the process for proposers, especially new ones who won't necessary understand the nuances within the catalyst voting process. As a CA/vCA in catalyst and through running countless project review boards i have read through many proposals/business cases/change requests to come at this with first hand experience.
f6_assessments.q1:
i assume the plan, budget and resource estimates for the build have been validated by Blace.io. They all look sensible for the production of a working tool.
Having said that, ideally a breakdown of the technical delivery for each sprint would have been provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
The high level milestones are clear, However the success criteria could be smarter eg.
- X of mentors registered and active on the platform (a definition of active is required)
- x proposers matched with mentors
- x mentored proposals funded in fund 7/8 (?)'  
Making these specific provides greater assurance to the community that we will get value for money. at the moment the proposal says we will build a tool and count some stuff (mentor, proposer participation) so the only piece it actually commits to is building a tool which is only half the battle.

In addition the risks/mitigations should be called out: eg the obvious one is that Blace.io do not proceed  or suitable developers cannot be found in time or development time/cost runs over budget.

The additional aspect not covered in this proposal is around mentors. Is there a willing cohort of people willing to become mentors? is there a mentor onboarding approach (could be another proposal or an extension to this one) or even a mitigation (ie pivot the project to focus on mentors if the technical build is taking longer than expected to get off the ground)

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
 Yes. The difficulty proposers face in submitting high quality proposals which obtain funding.


Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
 Yes. 

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes 
 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
 Three metrics have been specified.



Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes


Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes 


The project meets the requirements to create an Impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Yes he has provided profiles of team members and links to the funded projects they have done.
 
Are these links sufficient?
Yes 
 
Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
Yes

 
Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
yes they are competent. 

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
Yes  

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
Yes they have 



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Yes

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
 Yes

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No verifiable plan for additional funding 

Have you verified this plan?
No 


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
 
Yes timetable is realistic

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?

Yes it is sensible and conductible.

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes the resources are adequate.
 

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Yes Technical aspects like blace marketplace are explained. 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
 Yes they have been considered to an extent.
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes
 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Yes.


Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes the problem is clear.


Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes. 

 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No challenges have been identified.




 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
None identified.



Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has clearly defined the problem and provided statistics and real world experience of it to back it up. They have also offered us a very clear and concise solution, with a benefit hypothesis.
Offering proposers a method to engage mentors ahead of submitting a proposal means that their time will be spent more efficiently. I feel that this will provide a wholesome and beneficial experience of Project Catalyst process, which is necessary if we are to increase the attraction of people that are currently outside of the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal plan shows that the team has the relevant experience and understanding to be able to execute the solution well. 
The proposed timeline looks sensible and by providing an MVP allows the plan to be adjusted to ensure that value is being delivered. 
As a SAFe certified Agile coach I can see that their understanding of the personas that will be involved in the solution and the value that it will provide is clear.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs are clear and will measure successful update of both user journeys.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is perfect, but having a platform only for mentors feels limiting. I suggest increasing the scope and join forces with a similar idea.

overlap with 

https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Cardano-Community-Campus/369923-48088

I can find it better to have a platform, for example:

1. mentoring
2. looking for members
3. looking for a project
..
..
..

rather than only

1. mentoring
f6_assessments.q1: cardano AIM team is legit, I believe they can deliver since they already delivered previous tools to the finish line.
f6_assessments.q2:
definitely can be audited.

Many key metrics can be measured 

number of users
numbers of mentors
stats over time

solution: 提案者が、確かな提案をするのに役立つ熟練したメンターを、カルダノのコミュニティから見つけることができるプラットフォームを開発する。
experience: アレックスは、23年以上にわたり技術系ビジネスに携わり、チームを率いてビジネスを立ち上げてきました。フィルは、アクティブなコミュニティメンバーであり、提案者であり、CAであり、メンターでもあります。
